original: Klason, Jacob Wilhelm Torbern, lasarettsläkare, Linköping, f. 5/7/89 i Lund av prof. Johan Peter K. o. Marie Louise Hill. G. 23 m. Irma Chris-tensson. Barn: Inga f. 24, Carin 26, Lilie 28, Carl 38. — Stud:ex. 09, med. kand. 14, med. lic. 18 o. med. dr 24, allt i Sthlm. Assiist. v. Radiumhemmet 17-18, tf. aman. v. Seraf:las. rönt-geninst. 18, aman. där 19, bitr. läk. 29-21, därunder tf. förest, fem mån., överläk. å röntgenavd. v. komm. sjukh. i Bergen, Norge, 21-24, las :läk. v. röntgenavd. å länslas. i Linköp. fr. 24. Stud:resor t. Engl. 19, Frankr. 20, USA 28. Skr.: avh. o. upps. i röntgenologi o. radiologi. RNO.
translated: Klason, Jacob Wilhelm Torbern, hospital physician, Linköping, born 5/7/89 in Lund to Professor Johan Peter K. and Marie Louise Hill. Married on 23 to Irma Christensson. Children: Inga, born 1924, Carin, born 1926, Lilie, born 1928, Carl, born 1938. Education: Graduated high school in 1909, medical candidate in 1914, medical licentiate in 1918, and medical doctor in 1924, all in Stockholm. Assistant at the Radiumhemmet from 1917-1918, temporary attendant at Seraf:las. X-ray institute in 1918, attendant there in 1919, assistant doctor from 1920-1921, including temporary supervisor for five months, senior physician at the X-ray department of the municipal hospital in Bergen, Norway from 1921-1924, hospital physician at the X-ray department of the county hospital in Linköping from 1924. Study trips to England in 1919, France in 1920, USA in 1928. Writings: dissertations and papers in radiology and radiology. Royal Norwegian Order of Merit (RNO).

structured.name: Jacob Wilhelm Torbern Klason
structured.publications: dissertations and papers in radiology and radiology
